page.title: 02THE MAYOR OF KNUTSFORD
page.content: The town was granted its first Charter in 1292 by William de Tabley. This provided for a borough Court for Knutsford. Burgesses were given power to elect a bailiff (Mayor) of Knutsford and the first holder of the office was John Hall in about 1300 a.d. The Mayor is elected by his or her fellow councillors and presides over Knutsford for a period of 12 months. When attending civic functions the Mayor must wear a chain of office. He or she can be re-elected any number of times. The Mayor attends council meetings twice a month. Every other year the Mayor of Knutsford visits our twin town, Montmorency in France to attend their cherry festival. Knutsford is in the borough of Macclesfield. The present Mayor is Mrs. Barbara Phibbs.
